solution.text:
Diameter of roller brush, d \(=_{j}_ \Rightarrow\)Radius, r \(=_{{Fraction(j,2)}}_=_{{j/Decimal(2)}}_\)
Length of roller brush, h\(=_{k}_\)
No. of revolutions of brush to paint an entire wall, n \(=_{l}_\)
Curved surface area of roller brush\(=2\pi rh\)
\(=2 \times \pi \times _{{j/Decimal(2)}}_ \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))*k),3)}}_cm^2\)
Surface area of the wall\(=\)curved surface area of the brush \(\times\) no. of revolutions of brush
\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))*k),3)}}_ \times _{l}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))*k*l),3)}}_cm^2\)
\(=_{{trunc(((2/Decimal(10000))*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))*k*l),3)}}_m^2\)

content.text:
The diameter of a roller required to paint a wall is \(_{j}_\)cm and its length is \(_{k}_\)cm. It takes \(_{l}_\) revolutions to paint an entire wall once.
Find the area of the wall in sq.m.
